issue.title: [Rust] [Parquet] Implement "spaced" version for non-dictionary encoding/decoding
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-4061](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-4061). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
To support Parquet/Arrow encoding/decoding, we need to implement a "spaced" version where slots for null values should be filled with undefined bytes.

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-4061?focusedCommentId=16753662) by Renjie Liu (liurenjie1024):*
Hi, `[~csun]` Are you working on this? This is a blocker for other parts of arrow reader. I can take this if you are not available.

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-4061?focusedCommentId=16753715) by Chao Sun (csun):*
`[~liurenjie1024]` I have a [PR](https://github.com/sunchao/parquet-rs/pull/193/) on parquet-rs repo for this. Let me copy it to arrow.

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-4061?focusedCommentId=16762620) by Krisztian Szucs (kszucs):*
Issue resolved by pull request 3510
<https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/3510>
